title: 【 雑談 】珍しく雑談をしようと思っております。【常闇トワ/ホロライブ】

entries.text: And that's the greeting I'm doing.

and streaming in that stable state.

it's too much on the abs.
raise your legs up a little,
put your hands behind your head,
look at your navel. It's like a slight V-shape.

and you could choose the case.

she swatched them all on her own hand for me.

but until she pointed it out, I didn't know.
She put it on her hand, and I was like, "Oh, true, this is silver and this is pink."
"Silver is a bit more subdued, but Pink brings out a cuter look, I think."
She was totally like a shop clerk.
The base color was the same, but the glitter was definitely different.
I learned a lot, and eventually went with the pink glitter one.
"I think this one brings out the cuteness," she said.
I picked the one Clerk Bibi recommended.

I learned a lot, it was fun.
we did a mystery solving game.

and she seemed to have a lot of fun.

Something amazing happened at the dance lesson.

When I asked, "The teacher isn't here?"
They said, "We weren't told about it."
No, no, if it's a dance lesson, there should be a teacher.
What do you mean, "We weren't told"?
or rather, there was another girl doing it with me.
I did it together with that girl.

while saying the words out loud,

so I can focus only on my movements.
a shocking thing that happened recently.

I've been in Hololive for 5 or 6 years,
The company, like, the upper management.
What kind of flow are they using, what are they doing?
I think about that a lot.
I kind of want to join and see.
But Towa is a huge efficiency freak,
so I'd probably end up saying something.
"wouldn't it be better to do this first?"
Even when I was doing part-time jobs,
I worked while thinking about that a lot.
if I had the chance to talk,
I might have said quite a bit.
They'd say, "We do it with this and this intent."
"and put it out at the same time here,"
"wouldn't it all come together at once?"
I'm the type who wants to know from the foundation up.
"With what intent are we doing this?"
I want to know starting there.
Yeah, I want to know why that rule exists.
I can say it to my boss.
it doesn't feel good doing it blindly.
If I just move like a robot.
If I ask "Why are we doing this?"
and get convinced, I can do it really well.
Yeah, realizing something I thought was useless was actually necessary.
Yeah, yeah, I can realize that.
So I end up asking because I want to be taught.
I say, "Why are we doing this useless thing?"
And when asked "What is this for?",
and told "We do it for these reasons,"
I go "I see, then this is needed."
And since I understand, I can optimize the work in other ways.
So things I don't understand or question, I tend to ask or speak up about.
Every time, if the company gives a vague explanation,
I ask my manager, "What does this mean?"
"What's the intent? What's the direction?" I ask a ton.
I always feel bad for my manager stuck in the middle.
If there's mutual understanding, we can cooperate better.
I'm the type who really wants to clear up doubts.
But it's work, so asking that...
Isn't it better to ask and do it right than not ask and do it half-heartedly?
Because you can run away with it.
Towa is getting "comment harassment" right now too.
things like this happen so much lately.
I really want to go get purified.
I want to go for an exorcism.
"I think the same as Towa-sama but I'm troubled by colleagues who don't work."

If they don't work, shouldn't you be allowed to say something?
I mean, isn't that being a salary thief?
you have no choice but to go to a company where they don't say that.
Like, if there's 10 units of work,
But when they say, "Split this work of 10 among 3 or 5 people,"
I'm sorry, but the person who is sharp and capable,
and can consider everything, probably does about 70%.
And the person who goes at their own pace and isn't considerate does 10%.
But the salary is the same? Towa gets so irritated.
That's why this job is good.
Because you get back what you put in.
I'll say it. I'll just say it.
If we have to split 10 units among 3 people,
and one person can't do anything,
first, I think of a position that fits them,
and give them the optimal solution.
"And you can cut 4 sheets at once," or something.
I give them that and blitz through the rest myself.
And then, when they start getting used to it...
since I gave them simple work, they get used to it.
"has this meaning and is done this way,"
Little by little, I plant knowledge of other tasks.
And then, "Try this today," like that.
I do it in a way that minimizes my own irritation.
even though I say all this,
there were times I got scolded like crazy.
There was a time I got scolded so much.
and there was a period where I gritted my teeth and worked hard.
I couldn't understand unless I went to my senior,
and I was told, "What are you thinking?"
But if it wasn't the same as the senior's, I'd get scolded,
or told off, so I asked, "Sorry, could you please teach me?"
so I was probably saying total nonsense.

So I was like, "I'm sorry, I'm truly sorry."
and she sent a screenshot like, "Here."

"Then let's do this here, and that there."

first of all, it was awful.
so I guess no one had any mental leeway.

because that kind senior was there,
